SmProcessing

Class EventOnsetProcess

  • java.lang.Object
    • SmProcessing.EventOnsetProcess

  • public class EventOnsetProcess
extends java.lang.Object
    This class handles the event onset processing for the larger V2 process work flow. Event onset detection involves removing any linear trends from the input acceleration, filtering, and then running the event onset detection algorithm.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      EventOnsetProcess(double lowcut, double highcut, double taper, int numrl, double ebuf)
      The event onset process constructor initializes variables for filtering and buffering of the onset time

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void findEventOnset(double[] acc, double dtime, VFileConstants.EventOnsetType emethod)
      Removes any linear trend in acceleration, then filters and finds the event onset
      int getPickIndex()
      getter for the event onset index
      int getStartIndex()
      getter for the start index, which is the array index for the start of the event with the buffer amount added
      double getTaperlengthAtEventOnset()
      getter for the length of the taper used at the start of the array during filtering.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventOnsetProcess

        public EventOnsetProcess(double lowcut,
                         double highcut,
                         double taper,
                         int numrl,
                         double ebuf)
        The event onset process constructor initializes variables for filtering and buffering of the onset time
        Parameters:
        lowcut - the filter low cutoff frequency
        highcut - the filter high cutoff frequency
        taper - the taper length from the configuration file
        numrl - the filter roll-off, which is 1/2 the filter order
        ebuf - the length of the requested buffer for the event onset

    • Method Detail

      • findEventOnset

        public void findEventOnset(double[] acc,
                           double dtime,
                           VFileConstants.EventOnsetType emethod)
                    throws SmException
        Removes any linear trend in acceleration, then filters and finds the event onset
        Parameters:
        acc - the acceleration array, this array is modified during processing
        dtime - the sampling interval in seconds per sample
        emethod - the event onset method to use
        Throws:
        SmException - if unable to calculate the filter parameters

      • getStartIndex

        public int getStartIndex()
        getter for the start index, which is the array index for the start of the event with the buffer amount added
        Returns:
        the buffered pick index

      • getPickIndex

        public int getPickIndex()
        getter for the event onset index
        Returns:
        the array index for the event onset

      • getTaperlengthAtEventOnset

        public double getTaperlengthAtEventOnset()
        getter for the length of the taper used at the start of the array during filtering. The amount used at the end of the array is controlled by the taper length value in the configuration file.
        Returns:
        the initial taper length
